meanings.sent1: I will preprogram the robot to move forward.
meanings.sent2: She likes to preprogram her coffee maker to start brewing in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to preprogram the school bell to ring every hour.
meanings.sent4: He preprogrammed his alarm clock to wake him up at 6 AM.
meanings.sent5: Remember to preprogram your phone with important reminders.

meanings.definition: A program that is set up in advance.
meanings.sent1: The preprogram for the event includes a detailed schedule.
meanings.sent2: The computer comes with a preprogram for basic tasks.
meanings.sent3: The preprogram on the thermostat keeps the house at a comfortable temperature.
meanings.sent4: She followed the preprogram on the DVD to set up the new device.
meanings.sent5: Make sure to check the preprogram on the TV for upcoming shows.
